KnowledgeBase.Title: csub
KnowledgeBase.RelatedVMInstructions: vmcadd vmcdiv vmcdivr vmcmul vmcdiv vmcsub

Function.Description: The csub is a built-in function that subtracts the second argument from the first Character argument and the result is expressed as a Character.

Brief.Overview: The csub built-in function subtracts the second argument from the first Character argument and the result is expressed as a Character. The operands are not checked and are not coerced. Both operands are treated as integers during the subtraction operation.
Brief.Usage: The csub built-in function is a simple but very fast Character subtraction function. Use the csub function for highly optimized Character subtraction.
